<h1>Muktinath Pashupatinath Tour Package</h1>
<p><span><a href="/" title="Home">Home</a> » <a href="/nepal-tour-packages" title="Nepal Tour Packages">Nepal</a> » <a href="/muktinath-tour-packages" title="Muktinath Tour Packages">Muktinath</a> » <span class="breadcrumb_last" aria-current="page">Muktinath Pashupatinath Tour Package</span></span></p>
</div>

<div id="cmsmasters_row_673c333d8b1149_44652884" class="cmsmasters_row cmsmasters_color_scheme_default tourflexBox cmsmasters_row_top_default cmsmasters_row_bot_default cmsmasters_row_boxed">

<div class="cmsmasters_row_outer">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_inner">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_margin">
<div class="cmsmasters_column two_third">
<div class="custom_html tourIB1">
<div class="proGall"><img decoding="async" src="/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/muktinath-pashupatinath-tour.jpg" alt="Muktinath Pashupatinath Tour Package" title="Muktinath Pashupatinath Tour Package" width="750" height="450" loading="lazy"></div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB2">
<div class="tour-overview">
<div class="toBt"><i class="fa fa-file"></i> Tour Overview</div>
<p>Visit the pilgrimage hub spot of Nepal to Muktinath, Pashupatinath and Valmiki ashram through this incredible package. Explore the beauty and spirituality this place has to offer now. These places are popular for their religious significance, importance in Hinduism. This is a once in a lifetime opportunity which should not be missed out on. This package is curated with care to offer you a hassle free expedition of some of the most pious and sacred destinations in Nepal.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB4">
<div class="tour-collection">
<h2 class="tourDBox"><i class="fa fa-bus" aria-hidden="true"></i> Muktinath Pashupatinath Tour Itinerary Package</h2>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details" id="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 1 :</span>Arrival in Kathmandu</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="">
<p>Upon your arrival at Kathmandu our tour representative will escort you to your hotel from your point of arrival for an overnight stay. In the evening you will be taken to the famous Pashupatinath temple to attend the beautiful and holy evening Aarti.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 2 :</span>Kathmandu – Manakamana Temple – Pokhara</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>After having your breakfast the next morning you will be driven to Pokhara which you will be covering via a road journey of 6 hours. En route you will be taken to the famous Manakamana Temple where the incarnation of goddess Bhagwati is worshipped. Praying here is believed to fulfill all your wishes. Finally upon reaching the beautiful nature’s retreat Pokhara you will be checked in to your hotel for an overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 3 :</span>Pokhara – Jomsom – Muktinath – Jomsom</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>After completing your breakfast in the morning you will be flown to Jomsom which is situated at a distance of 35 minutes via flying from Pokhara. On reaching the helipad you will be driven to the temple of Muktinath which is known as the god of salvation. Here you will be taking a holy bath under the 108 water spouts or Muktidhara which is believed to grant moksha. Finally you will be driven back to your hotel in Jomsom for an overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 4 :</span>Jomsom – Pokhara (Sightseeing)</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Early in the morning you will be flown back to Pokhara where you will be taken on a city sightseeing tour. You will be visiting places like: Bindabasini Temple – dedicated to a manifestation of goddess Bhagwati; Barahi Temple – an important structure in Pokhara Amidst the Phewa Lake and on Saturdays people take male animals for sacrifice to the deity; Seti Gorge – a powerful gorge with the gushing Gandaki River flowing through it making it a sight to behold; Devi’s fall – a tranquil waterfall and Gupteshwar Cave – a serene natural cave containing a small temple inside dedicated to lord shiv.</p>
<p>By the evening you will be taken back to your hotel for straying the night.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 5 :</span>Pokhara – Chitwan National Park</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>You will drive to Chitwan national park from Pokhara early in the morning which will be a journey of almost 4.5 hours. Upon reaching Chitwan you will be given some time to freshen then taken on a safari riding an elephant’s back. You will be exploring the rich and thriving jungle where you will encounter a number of fauna collection like – deer, one horned rhino, bison, leopard and if lucky you may just encounter the royal Bengal tiger. This ride lasts for 2 to 3 hours. Later ib you can also go on a canoeing trip down the quiet Rapti River and witness some exotic birds.</p>
<p>Chitwan National ParkAfter a thrilling and exciting day you will be assisted back to your hotel in the national park where you will be staying the night.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 6 :</span>Chitwan National Park – Devghat – Valmiki Ashram</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>After having your breakfast early in the morning you will be making your way to Devghat which is situated at a driving distance of 7 hours. Once you reach the Ghat you will be transferred to a boat to cross Narayani River Valmiki Ashram, the exact place where Valmiki is said to have written Ramayan. After you visit this serene ashram you will be driven back to your hotel in Chitwan for an overnight stay. At night you will also be engaged in a Tharu culture of dance show which will be a fun unique experience.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 7 :</span>Chitwan – Kathmandu</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>You will be driven from Chitwan to Kathmandu after your breakfast early in the morning. This will be a road journey of 6 hours. You be treated with some of the most scenic and fascinating views of the surrounding natural beauty during the journey. On reaching Kathmandu you will be checked in to your hotel for an overnight stay. The evening time will be free for you to explore the nearby places like market and other interesting destinations on foot if you want.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 8 :</span>Kathmandu Sightseeing</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>After having your breakfast early in the morning you will be taken on a sightseeing tour of Kathmandu. You will be covering the following Places: Dakshinkali Temple – a top pilgrimage destination in Nepal where people come to worship Maa Kali and perform animal sacrifices here; Sheh Narayan – 1 of the 4 remaining Narayans in Kathmandu and very significant temple. You will also be taken for a visit to the Talles Shiv Statue in the world known as Sanga. After offering your prayers and rituals to the deities you will be taken to the vibrant and extremely popular market place of Durbar Quare – there are innumerable places that you can explore inside the square including traditional Buddhist monasteries and even some market places offering interesting items for sale.</p>
<p>Finally after a fun filled day you will be taken back to your hotel for staying the night.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 9 :</span>Kathmandu Departure</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>After breakfast you will be assisted to your departure destination which will mark the end of your Pashupatinath, Muktinath and Valmiki Ashram package with us. You will be boarding the flight heading on ahead to your desired destination.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="custom_html tourIB8">
<div id="popularBox8" class="tour-collection">
<h3><i class="fa fa-question-circle" aria-hidden="true"></i> FAQs for Muktinath Pashupatinath Package</h3>
<div class="panel-body">
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> How Old Is Muktinath?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> This temple's history dates back to the nineteenth century, and Hindus are thought to have consecrated it.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> In Muktinath Temple, Which God Is Worshipped?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Lord Narayana (or Vishnu) is a Hindu deity revered as the world's protector and preserver, as well as the restorer of all things (moral order). He is best known through his avatars (incarnations), especially Rama and Krishna.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Makes The Pashupatinath Temple Unique?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> This ornately decorated temple with wooden sculptures is said to grant wishes. The massive golden statue of Nandi, Shiva's bull, is one of the temple's most impressive decorations. Only Hindus are permitted to enter the main temple, but all other buildings are open to the public.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Is The Pashupatinath Legend?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> According to one legend, Shiva and Parvati once visited the Bagmati River. They were so taken with the place that they decided to make it their home. They took the form of two deer and settled here.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Why Is Shiva Referred To As Pashupati?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Lord Shiva is revered as the Lord of Wisdom - Jnanam Maheshwarat Icchet. Only through Lord Shiva's grace can the Jiva be freed from the pasha or maya's bondage. As a result, the name Pashupati refers to the Lord who can deliver the Pashu from the clutches of the pasha and grant liberation.</p>
</p></div></div></div></div></div>
</div>
</div>

Explore the beauty and spirituality this place has to offer now. These places are popular for their religious significance, importance in Hinduism....
